item.title: Dareer: Brandeis Alumni's Career Path Database
item.description: Why Dareer While I was working as an office assistant at Brandeis University, I was assigned to collect, clean, and visualize all CS alumni’s data, including their majors and their job history (companies and the corresponding employment duration). We spent six months just on collecting all the data and put it into a large Google Sheet file, and then we spent an entire semester on cleaning it. We had a large team and without a clear documentation, different people had different habit of recording the data.

item.title: How to Go and Grab a Coffee while Keeping Your Vim Running on CLAC
item.description: While taking the Advanced Programming class, the thing that bothers me the most is not that we need to program using Vim in CLAC, a remote server, but every time when I leave for a cup of coffee, my laptop sleeps, and CLAC connection is automatically closed, so I have to type clac, cd cs3157/labN/part1, vim xxx.c again and again, which is really annoying. Jae briefly mentioned a handy tool, called tmux, in listserv, and I found that is useful if you are a coffee person like me.
